name: Eligibility Improvement Cases
description: Tests that the agent correctly diagnoses hidden eligibility blockers and offers actionable remediation across compensation, scheduling, health compliance, transportation, employment, skills, environment, comfort preferences, and operational readiness.

scenarios.name: Pay Rate / Minimum Hours Mismatch
scenarios.description: Caregiver demands $32/hr and 35+ hrs/week in a market where typical rates are $20-27/hr and 10-30 hrs/week. Agent should confirm constraints, explain eligibility impact, offer options, and record flexibility.

scenarios.name: Shift Length Constraint Alignment
scenarios.description: Caregiver only wants 1-2 hour visits, but market demand is for 4-8 hour shifts. Agent should explain the mismatch, probe flexibility, propose alternatives, and record updated constraints.

scenarios.name: Start Date Delay — Waitlist and Pre-Clear
scenarios.description: Caregiver cannot start for 3 weeks due to travel. Agent should confirm date, explain impact, pre-clear remediable steps, and offer future-start matching.

scenarios.name: Vaccination and Health Screen Gap Resolution
scenarios.description: Caregiver has missing flu shot, unknown COVID vaccine status, and expired TB test. Agent should clarify each item, explain case-type impact, offer scheduling, and update records.

scenarios.name: Transportation Proof and Case Routing
scenarios.description: Caregiver can drive but lacks insurance documentation. Agent should clarify capability, explain verification requirements, offer two tracks (upload proof or non-driving routing), and record decision.

scenarios.name: Employment Classification Alignment (W-2 vs 1099)
scenarios.description: Caregiver only accepts W-2, but 65% of cases are 1099. Agent should confirm constraint, explain eligibility impact with numbers, route to compatible pools, and record firmness.

scenarios.name: Specialty Skills Assessment and Training Path
scenarios.description: Caregiver has dementia care experience, unknown Hoyer lift proficiency, and no catheter care skill. Agent should assess each skill, explain eligibility impact, offer training, and record accurately.

scenarios.name: Home Environment Constraints Capture
scenarios.description: Caregiver cannot be around cats or smoke. Agent should clarify hard vs soft constraints, explain match-pool reduction, and record in structured queryable format.

scenarios.name: Gender and Comfort Preferences — Boundary Setting
scenarios.description: Caregiver only works with women and refuses toileting/bathing tasks. Agent should confirm boundaries, explain eligibility impact, offer adjacent task sets, and avoid pressure.

scenarios.name: EVV and Documentation Readiness
scenarios.description: Caregiver has smartphone but low app familiarity and unknown documentation comfort. Agent should explain EVV/notes workflows, run readiness check, offer support options, and record readiness level.
